title-group.article-title: Pseudo bond graph modeling of wastewater treatment bioprocesses

article-meta.aff: Department of Automatic Control, University of Craiova, Romania

author-notes.corresp: Monica Roman, Department of Automatic Control, University of Craiova, A.I. Cuza no. 13, Craiova, Romania Email: monica@automation.ucv.ro

fn.p: Monica Roman is an assistant professor of automatic control at the University of Craiova, Romania. She received her BS degree (2003) and her MSc degree (2005) in automatic control, and her PhD degree in control systems (2009) from the University of Craiova. Her research interests are in non-linear systems, modeling and simulation, and system identification. She is author of more than 30 research papers in international journals and conferences. In 2005 she was awarded a Marie Curie Fellowship which she spent at HEUDIASYC CNRS, Université de Technologie de Compiègne, France. She is member of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE), the Romanian Society of Automation and Technical Informatics (SRAIT), and the Romanian Robotics Association (ARR).

Dan Selisteanu is professor of automatic control at the University of Craiova, Romania. He received his electrical engineering degree (1989) and his PhD in automatic control (1999) from the University of Craiova, Romania. His research interests are in adaptive and sliding mode control and the modeling and control of bioprocesses. He is author of more than 90 research papers in international journals and conferences and over five books. He is co-founder and scientific chancellor of the Research Center ‘Nonlinear automation. Stability and oscillations’. He is member of the IEEE, SRAIT, and ARR.

abstract.p: The modeling of biotechnological processes is a complex task, because of the high interaction degree of the phenomena, non-linearities, and uncertainties of reaction kinetics. A novel approach for bioprocess modeling, based on pseudo bond graphs, is proposed in this paper. Bond graph method is an appropriate tool for modeling non-linear processes, eventually along with their control systems. Firstly, the pseudo bond graph method is applied in order to model some prototype bioprocesses starting from the reactions schemes and taking into account the biochemical phenomena. Then the rules used for the design of these models are applied on two widespread wastewater treatment processes. The first is an activated sludge bioprocess taking place in a sequential batch reactor, and the second is a wastewater biodegradation with the production of methane gas, which is carried out inside a continuous stirred tank bioreactor. The obtained bond graph models and several simulations are conducted using the 20sim modeling and simulation environment. This modeling procedure represents a valuable illustration of the power of the bond graph technique, and can be used as a base for the development of models of bioprocesses with a high level of complexity.
